business.headline: Why young, wealthy Indians are skipping the West for DubaiWhy is Dubai now outperforming the West in attracting young Indian investors and professionals? Have a look.

IndiGo crisis, inflation, capacity: How Centre fixed Rs 7,500–18,000 fare capsIndia's Ministry of Civil Aviation has imposed emergency caps on domestic airfares following IndiGo's massive flight cancellations, aiming to protect passengers from soaring ticket prices during the peak travel season. This intervention seeks to stabilise the market amid one of the worst aviation disruptions in recent years.

Can RBI's liquidity boost give the sinking rupee a lifeboat?Liquidity can calm markets, not rewrite global conditions. As the rupee battles external shocks, will the RBI's latest push prove enough to anchor sentiment or simply slow an inevitable slide?

Noose tightens around Anil Ambani's Reliance Power as ED files chargesheetThe money laundering case is linked to the issuance of an alleged fake bank guarantee of Rs 68 crore for securing a Solar Energy Corporation of India tender.

Simone Tata, the quiet force behind Lakmé and Westside, dies at 95Simone Tata, a figure behind some of India's most recognizable retail and cosmetics brands, passed away at 95, leaving a legacy marked by innovation and leadership.

Lower lending rates ahead? From ICICI to SBI, your home loan rate checkIndia's central bank has reduced the repo rate by 25 basis points. This move is likely to influence home loan interest rates and stimulate activity across the housing and real estate sectors.

Netflix to buy Warner Bros Discovery's studios, streaming unit in $72 billion dealNetflix has agreed to buy Warner Bros Discovery's TV, film and streaming businesses, bringing the iconic studio under its control.

India's forex reserves decline for second week to $686.2 billion: ReportIndia's foreign exchange reserves fell for the second consecutive week, slipping by $1.877 billion to $686.227 billion in the week ended November 28, 2025.

Rs 1.2 lakh invested, only Rs 10,000 earned? The truth behind SIP mathsInvestors often overlook the real timeline of their investments when assessing SIP returns. Understanding the compounding effect and the actual period money stays invested can make a significant difference in evaluating returns.

Sensex, Nifty end higher as RBI cuts lending rate, offers liquidity supportThe Sensex ended at 85,712.37, up 447.05 points, while the Nifty50 settled at 26,186.45, gaining 152.70 points. Most of the broader market indices also ended the trading session on a positive note.

Victim of regulatory vacuum: Avadhut Sathe Training Academy denies allegationsSebi's interim order said the academy and its founder were running an unregistered investment advisory service under the guise of training programmes and had collected large sums of money from the public.

IndiGo flight cancellations: What passengers need to know about refundsIndiGo has informed the DGCA that full operational stabilisation is expected only by February 10, 2026, with continued cancellations anticipated until December 8.​

IndiGo crisis sends Delhi–Mumbai flight prices soaring to over Rs 80,000The Delhi–Mumbai corridor, which connects the national capital with the country's financial centre, is one of the busiest air routes globally. Any disruption on this route immediately affects business travellers, tourists, and daily commuters.

When two airlines rule the skies: Is India's aviation duopoly failing flyers?IndiGo's mass cancellations have exposed a deeper fault line in Indian aviation, where a growing duopoly means one airline's trouble can disrupt travel plans for the entire country.

Will personal loans become cheaper after the RBI's latest repo rate cut?Are borrowers finally set to get some relief as the RBI trims the repo rate by 25 basis points? Could this policy shift translate into lower personal loan rates soon? Read here.
Your FD investments to take a hit as RBI cuts repo rateIs your FD income set to shrink as banks prepare to reduce deposit rates after the RBI's rate cut? Let's have a look.

RBI reduces repo rate by 25 bps. Will your home loans get cheaper?RBI Governor Sanjay Malhotra said the committee unanimously agreed on the rate cut after assessing inflation trends, growth forecasts and liquidity needs.

IndiGo shares tumble 2% as mass flight cancellations continue to disrupt travel IndiGo's stock fell over 2%, trading at Rs 5,326.35 by 10 am, amid mounting concerns over ongoing mass cancellations and delays across India's busiest airports.

RBI reduces key lending rate by 25 points to 5.25%, maintains neutral stanceThe rate cut takes the repo rate down from 5.5% to 5.25%. Alongside this, the Standing Deposit Facility (SDF) rate has been adjusted to 5%, while the Marginal Standing Facility (MSF) rate and the bank rate now stand at 5.5%.

Who is Avadhut Sathe, Pune finfluencer whose trading academy got banned by SebiSebi said that Avadhut Sathe Trading Academy was running an unregistered investment advisory business disguised as education, misleading investors through selective performance claims, paid WhatsApp groups, and live market recommendations.

entertainment.headline: Bigg Boss 19 grand finale: Gaurav, Farrhana, Amaal, Tanya, Pranit - who'll win? Bigg Boss 19 finale live updates: The grand finale of the 19th season of the controversial reality show, Bigg Boss, is set to be held tonight. Among the five finalists, one will take home the winner's trophy, along with Rs 50 lakh prize money.

Salman Khan melts hearts as he personally meets young fans in Hyderabad. Watch Actor Salman Khan attended the Indian Supercross Racing League event in Hyderabad, taking time to meet and interact with young fans. The gesture was widely shared on social media, with many praising Khan's approachable manner and engagement with attendees.

People react easily to rumours: Palaash responds after Smriti calls off wedding Musician Palash Muchhal and cricketer Smriti Mandhana have separately confirmed the end of their relationship and called off their wedding, with Muchhal warning of strict legal action against those spreading false and defamatory information.

Daayra: Meghna Gulzar starts final shoot with Kareena and Prithviraj Filmmaker Meghna Gulzar has begun the last phase of filming for her directorial project Daayra, starring Kareena Kapoor Khan and Prithviraj Sukumaran.

Confirmed: Mohanlal to play Prithviraj's grandfather in Khalifa Mohanlal has been confirmed to play Prithviraj Sukumaran's grandfather, Mambarakkal Ahmed Ali, in the Malayalam action thriller 'Khalifa'. The film, structured in two parts, explores the violent and influential history of the Mambarakkal family in the underworld.

Dhurandhar Day 2 box office: Ranveer's film shows strong hold. See numbers here Actor Ranveer Singh's latest film Dhurandhar, released on December 5, has made a powerful debut at the Indian box office. Early estimates show significant earnings across its first weekend, with high occupancy in both mass and urban centres.

Legalities keep changing: Rana Daggubati addresses SIT betting-app questioning Actor Rana Daggubati has addressed his recent questioning by the Special Investigation Team in connection with an ongoing investigation into illegal betting and gambling app promotion in Telangana.

Kriti Sanon poses with Dakota Johnson, Adrien Brody at Red Sea Film Festival Actor Kriti Sanon attends the Red Sea International Film Festival in Saudi Arabia, sharing insights on her role in Tere Ishk Mein and reflecting on the resurgence of love stories in Hindi cinema amid strong box office competition.

Our humour shouldn't be lost: Anukalp Goswami on Kis Kis Ko Pyaar Karoon 2 Comedian Kapil Sharma teams up with writer-director Anukalp Goswami for Kis Kisko Pyaar Karoon 2, a sequel designed to reflect India's diversity while maintaining a thoughtful approach to humour.

Netflix's Playing Gracie Darling rekindles the magic of occult horror. Here's how In a world full of loud jump scares, Netflix's Playing Gracie Darling brings back the quiet, unsettling charm of occult horror. With its eerie seance gone wrong and a story that ties supernatural fear to human cruelty, the series shows how old traumas keep echoing through generations.

Gaurav, Farrhana, Amaal, Pranit or Tanya: Whose show was Bigg Boss 19 really? With Bigg Boss Season 19 finale scheduled for December 7, here's a look at the five finalists and all that made each of them stand out.

Bigg Boss 19 Ep 105: Amaal, Pranit, Tanya get emotional reliving their journeys Farrhana Bhatt, Tanya Mittal, Amaal Mallik, Gaurav Khanna, and Pranit More are the top five finalists competing for the Bigg Boss 19 trophy, with the grand finale hosted by Salman Khan scheduled for December 7, 2025.

Katy Perry goes Instagram official with Justin Trudeau on Japan trip Pop star Katy Perry and former Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau publicly confirmed their relationship on Instagram, sharing photos from their recent trip to Japan, where they met former Japanese Prime Minister Fumio Kishida.

Mammootty honours Mohanlal on Patriot set after Dadasaheb Phalke Award win The cast and crew of upcoming socio-political thriller Patriot marked Mohanlal's Dadasaheb Phalke Award with a special ceremony as anticipation builds for the film's 2026 release.

Is Taylor Swift marrying Travis Kelce in Rhode Island on June 13, 2026? Read here Singer Taylor Swift and NFL Travis Kelce's anticipated wedding is reportedly set for June 13, 2026, in Rhode Island. Reports suggest the couple have secured a luxury venue near Swift's Watch Hill property, with significant interest in the date and location.

Bigg Boss 19: Is Wikipedia screenshot leaking winner's name real? Fact check here Speculation intensified when a reported screenshot of Wikipedia featuring names of Bigg Boss 19 contestants went viral. The list even showed a winner, leaving fans debating authenticity of the claim.

Salman Khan, Chitrangda Singh's BTS moment from Battle of Galwan goes viral Actor Salman Khan has completed shooting for the war drama Battle of Galwan, which depicts the 2020 Galwan Valley clash between Indian and Chinese troops. The film, directed by Apoorva Lakhia, is inspired by true events detailed in India's Most Fearless 3 and features Khan in the role of Colonel B Santosh Babu.

Divya Khosla shuts down divorce buzz with Bhushan Kumar: Media really wants it Actor-filmmaker Divya Khosla Kumar openly discussed her experiences in Bollywood, her personal and professional life, and addressed ongoing rumours in a candid Reddit Ask Me Anything session.

Shaheer Sheikh reunites with Navya co-actor Somya Seth at her sister's wedding Shaheer Sheikh attended Prakriti Seth's wedding, reuniting with his former co-star Somya Seth. The actors were seen together in celebration, sharing moments from the ceremony on social media.

general news.headline: Narrow exit, crowded floor, palm leaves: How Goa club turned into death trapA fire broke out shortly after midnight on Sunday at Goa's Arpora nightclub, Birch by Romeo Lane, claiming 25 lives and sparking concerns over the venue's safety measures.

Smriti Mandhana says wedding with Palash Muchhal is offIndia cricketer Smriti Mandhana has broken her silence on her wedding to Palash Muchhal. In an Instagram story, Mandhana confirmed for the first time that the wedding was off and requested privacy for both families.

IndiGo says 95% connectivity re-established, plans to operate 1,500 flights today  Live UpdatesEven as IndiGo moved to recover, the DGCA issued show cause notices to CEO Pieter Elbers and Accountable Manager Isidro Porqueras over major operational lapses linked to revised duty-time rules. Civil Aviation Minister K Rammohan Naidu reviewed the situation and said action will follow based on enquiry findings.

Exclusive video captures chaos at Goa nightclub as fire startedThe fire broke out around midnight at Birch by Romeo Lane, a club in Baga, one of Goa's most popular beaches, following a suspected cylinder blast. Police said most of the victims appeared to be staff members. At least 25 people were killed in the devastating fire.

Strict vetting, non-disclosure pact: How secret commune of stoners worksDespite marijuana being illegal under Indian law, a secret Himalayan retreat, or many, take place, and draw stoners from across the country. These closed gatherings promise anonymity, bonding, and a "functional stoner lifestyle", even as participants risk jail time and heavy fines under the NDPS Act. For the stoners, the vibe is more important than a jail term.

People react easily to rumours: Palaash responds after Smriti calls off weddingMusician Palash Muchhal and cricketer Smriti Mandhana have separately confirmed the end of their relationship and called off their wedding, with Muchhal warning of strict legal action against those spreading false and defamatory information.

Did Jaspal Bhatti predict IndiGo crisis? His old 'SOS Airlines' clip feels too realA decades-old Jaspal Bhatti comedy clip has surfaced online, drawing parallels with IndiGo's current flight cancellations and pilot shortages. The satire's uncanny accuracy triggered nostalgia and debate over airline mismanagement.
100 people on floor when flames broke out: Eyewitness recalls Goa nightclub fireEyewitnesses recounted how the deadly fire at Birch by Romeo Lane in Goa unfolded and the chaos that followed.

Gaurav, Farrhana, Amaal, Pranit or Tanya: Whose show was Bigg Boss 19 really?With Bigg Boss Season 19 finale scheduled for December 7, here's a look at the five finalists and all that made each of them stand out.

Pak woman seeks PM Modi's help as husband plans second marriage in DelhiA Pakistani woman has appealed to PM Modi for justice, alleging that her husband abandoned her at the Attari border and is preparing for a second marriage in Delhi.

Virat Kohli visits Simachalam temple after rediscovering form in ODI seriesIND vs SA: Virat Kohli offered prayers at the Simachalam temple after India's series win in Vizag. Kohli rediscovered his mojo in the series and played three stunning innings.

Kesavananda on stage: Constitutional pedagogy or a privileged powerplay?The re-enactment of Kesavananda Bharati at OP Jindal Global Law School was more than a moot. It was a display of India's constitutional soul. But a constitutional soul cannot belong to a privileged few.

Ro-Ko rollercoaster: 2025 began with despair, ends with hopeThe Rohit Sharma–Virat Kohli ride of 2025 has shifted from despair to hope. From May's Test farewells to a career-defining South Africa series in December, Ro-Ko remain the central theme of Indian cricketing diaspora.

Our cosmos, continent, country and conflictNorth-based pundits, politicians, and academics have historically committed the intellectual trespass of equating the entirety of Bharat with Aryavart, despite their preceptor Manu's own Deccan delineation. In their narrative, the subcontinent becomes the exclusive, unbroken motherland of an indigenous Aryan identity.

Dhurandhar Day 2 box office: Ranveer's film shows strong hold. See numbers hereActor Ranveer Singh's latest film Dhurandhar, released on December 5, has made a powerful debut at the Indian box office. Early estimates show significant earnings across its first weekend, with high occupancy in both mass and urban centres.

Why young, wealthy Indians are skipping the West for DubaiWhy is Dubai now outperforming the West in attracting young Indian investors and professionals? Have a look.

Stay in your domain: Gambhir slams IPL team owner, media in epic rantGautam Gambhir defended his coaching amid criticism following India's ODI series win against South Africa. He criticised an IPL owner for interfering with team decisions, highlighting challenges faced in Test cricket.

Climate change is hurting India's food pricesUnseasonal rains and rising heat and heatwaves have already hurt farmers across multiple states this year, damaging crops, and creating shortages before the produce even reaches markets.

Here's howIn a world full of loud jump scares, Netflix's Playing Gracie Darling brings back the quiet, unsettling charm of occult horror. With its eerie seance gone wrong and a story that ties supernatural fear to human cruelty, the series shows how old traumas keep echoing through generations.

Mysterious pillars of light seen falling from space. It's not aliensThe photograph has renewed interest in these ghostly lights, which appear for just milliseconds and are usually hidden from view by the very storms that create them.​

No calls, emails after work: Right to Disconnect Bill introduced in Lok SabhaThe bill proposes granting every employee the right to disconnect from work-related calls and emails beyond official work hours and on holidays.

Four plates, zero stress: Why women are swiping right on double datesA new report reveals that women are three times more likely to prefer double dates, and the reasons go far deeper than just having a safety net against creeps.

Salman Khan melts hearts as he personally meets young fans in Hyderabad. WatchActor Salman Khan attended the Indian Supercross Racing League event in Hyderabad, taking time to meet and interact with young fans. The gesture was widely shared on social media, with many praising Khan's approachable manner and engagement with attendees.

Daayra: Meghna Gulzar starts final shoot with Kareena and PrithvirajFilmmaker Meghna Gulzar has begun the last phase of filming for her directorial project Daayra, starring Kareena Kapoor Khan and Prithviraj Sukumaran.

sports.headline: Rahul Rawat: Smriti Mandhana Calls Off Wedding With Palash Muchhal, Cites Privacy In this India Today broadcast, Senior Sports Editor Rahul Rawat and Reporter Anjali Pandey report on the cancellation of cricketer Smriti Mandhana's wedding to music composer Palash Muchhal. Mandhana confirmed the split on Instagram, stating, 'I need to clarify that the wedding is called off.' She emphasized her desire for privacy and focus on representing India. Muchhal also released a statement, saying he is 'moving on' and 'stepping back from his personal relationship.' He further warned that his team will take 'strict legal action against those spreading false and defamatory content.' The segment discusses the timeline, including the initial postponement due to Mandhana's father's illness.

Repeat on 2019: Jofra Archer, Steve Smith engage in heated battle at Gabba Ashes: Australia captain Steve Smith engaged in a heated battle with England's Jofra Archer in the final moments of the 2nd Test match. Facing heat from Archer, a fired up Smith hooked him for a six and uttered some stern words to the bowler.

Stokes' fight not enough as Australia crush England in pink-ball Test, go 2-0 up Australia dominated the second Ashes Test at The Gabba in Brisbane to take a 2-0 lead in the series. The hosts were set a target of 65 runs in the fourth innings and chased it down with eight wickets to spare.

Smriti Mandhana says wedding with Palash Muchhal is off India cricketer Smriti Mandhana has broken her silence on her wedding to Palash Muchhal. In an Instagram story, Mandhana confirmed for the first time that the wedding was off and requested privacy for both families.

Virat Kohli visits Simachalam temple after rediscovering form in ODI series IND vs SA: Virat Kohli offered prayers at the Simachalam temple after India's series win in Vizag. Kohli rediscovered his mojo in the series and played three stunning innings.

Chinnaswamy pride of Bengaluru, IPL will not shift from here: Karnataka Deputy CM Karnataka Deputy CM D.K. Shivakumar has said that IPL matches will not be moved from Bengaluru's M. Chinnaswamy Stadium. The decision follows plans to improve safety and develop an alternative stadium after last year's stampede incident.

Michael Rae drafted into New Zealand squad for second Test vs West Indies New Zealand have called up uncapped pacer Michael Rae for the second Test against West Indies. Injuries to Matt Henry and Nathan Smith have forced the hosts to bolster their bowling attack for the second Test.

Lionel Messi masterclass helps Inter Miami win first ever MLS title Lionel Messi helped Inter Miami to win their first ever MLS title on Sunday. Messi hit his iconic walk during the celebrations after Miami beat Vancouver 3-1 in the final of the tournament.

Abhishek Sharma becomes first Indian to hit 100 Sixes in a calendar year Abhishek Sharma made history by hitting 100 sixes in a calendar year during the Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy. He became the first Indian to achieve the feat, bettering his haul of 87 maximums in 2024.

Mohamed Salah lashes out at Liverpool: They have thrown me under the bus Liverpool forward Mohamed Salah has hit out at his club in the biggest rant of the season. After extending his contract last year, Salah's future at Liverpool is up in flames after the latest provocative comments.

After controversial Pakistan stint, Gary Kirsten joins Namibia before T20 World Cup Former South African cricketer Gary Kirsten has joined Namibia as a consultant to help prepare their men's team for the 2026 T20 World Cup, bringing his international coaching experience to strengthen the squad's performance.

5000 runs, 65-ball 100: Evergreen Ellyse Perry seals WBBL playoff spot for SixersEllyse Perry's blazing 111 off 71 balls propelled Sydney Sixers Women to a thrilling 1-run win over Adelaide Strikers, securing their first WBBL playoff spot since 2020.

Harshit Rana India's next all-rounder? Gautam Gambhir reveals big plans for pacerIND vs SA: India head coach Gautam Gambhir says the team views Harshit Rana as a developing bowling all-rounder whose growing batting ability could provide crucial balance at No. 8.

Abu Dhabi Grand Prix 2025: All you need to know about F1 title-deciderA three-way title fight, a pole-sitting champion, and a season finale built for drama — the 2025 Abu Dhabi Grand Prix has all the elements of a classic. Norris, Verstappen and Piastri now race for one decisive crown.

Mota hojaunga vapas: Rohit avoids cake as Virat enjoys it in celebrationIND vs SA: Rohit Sharma skipped the celebratory cake after India's nine-wicket win in Vizag, reflecting his renewed fitness focus and excellent recent form in ODI cricket.

Shukri Conrad puts grovel controversy to bed: Could've chosen a better wordIND vs SA: South Africa's head coach Shukri Conrad has addressed the controversy surrounding his use of the word 'grovel' following his team's landmark Test series win over India, clarifying his intentions and expressing regret over the distraction caused by the remark.

Ro-Ko rollercoaster: 2025 began with despair, ends with hopeThe Rohit Sharma–Virat Kohli ride of 2025 has shifted from despair to hope. From May's Test farewells to a career-defining South Africa series in December, Ro-Ko remain the central theme of Indian cricketing diaspora.

Why not? Sunil Gavaskar backs Virat Kohli to hit 100 hundreds, marvels ODI formIND v SA: Sunil Gavaskar backs Kohli to chase Tendulkar's iconic 100-hundreds mark, convinced the star batter's renewed form can carry him past 2027 and keep the record firmly within reach.

FIFA World Cup 2026 schedule revealed: Here's when Messi and Ronaldo start final runThe FIFA World Cup 2026 schedule is finally out as the first-ever 48-team edition takes shape. With matches spread across the USA, Mexico, and Canada, the tournament promises the biggest global spectacle football has ever seen.

India vs South Africa: Nikhil Naz Analyses India's Bowling Performance in Series DeciderIn this Special Report, India Today's Consulting Editor (Sports) Nikhil Naz analyses the crucial 3rd ODI between India and South Africa in Visakhapatnam. Naz highlights the significance of India finally winning the toss after a gap of 20 matches, terming it a 'massive relief' for captain KL Rahul. He explains how the 'dew' factor makes the toss vital, giving the chasing team a distinct advantage. The editor praises the bowling efforts of Kuldeep Yadav and Prasidh Krishna, who restricted the visitors to 270 runs—the first sub-300 total of the series. Naz notes that despite South Africa's strong start, India's disciplined bowling in the middle overs has placed them in the 'driver's seat' to win the series decider.

India vs South Africa: Kuldeep Yadav, Prasidh Krishna Pick 4 Wickets Each; De Kock Hits 7th TonOn this match analysis, the focus is on the ODI series between India and South Africa, where the Proteas were dismissed for 270. The speaker highlights the performance of Kuldeep Yadav and Prasidh Krishna, noting that 'the duo picked four wickets each'. The report details Kuldeep Yadav's comments on a new rule allowing only one ball between the 34th and 50th overs, which helped him exploit dry conditions. The programme also discusses Quinton de Kock's seventh ODI century against India and his impressive conversion rate.

Rant, relief and praise: Gautam Gambhir's fiery Vizag presser had it allIndia vs South Africa, 3rd ODI: Gautam Gambhir lashed out at an IPL team owner for suggesting split coaching, praised his players for bouncing back to win the ODI series, and reiterated his views on white-ball tactics in a fiery press conference that had it all on Saturday, December 6.

Max Verstappen storms to pole for title-deciding Abu Dhabi Grand PrixFormula 1: Max Verstappen delivered a flawless lap to seal pole for the title-deciding Abu Dhabi Grand Prix. With Norris and Piastri close behind, the championship fight now sets up a thrilling showdown at Yas Marina.

Stay in your domain: Gambhir slams IPL team owner, media in epic rantGautam Gambhir defended his coaching amid criticism following India's ODI series win against South Africa. He criticised an IPL owner for interfering with team decisions, highlighting challenges faced in Test cricket.

Watch: Virat Kohli paaji latest guest in Arshdeep Singh's viral Instagram reelIND vs SA: Arshdeep Singh had India stalwart Virat Kohli feature in one of his viral Instagram reels after the win in Visakhapatnam. The Player of the Series joined in the fun fresh off a dominant campaign, having scored 302 runs in three matches.

Ro-Ko bromance in Vizag: Rohit hugs Virat after India seal series winIND vs SA: Rohit Sharma wrapped Virat Kohli in a celebratory hug as India eased to a nine-wicket win in the third ODI in Vizag, their composed half-centuries setting up the series clincher against South Africa.

India Win ODI Series: Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma Silence Critics with Dominant PerformanceIn this special report, the focus is on India's remarkable ODI series victory, coming just weeks after a Test series loss. The discussion highlights how icons Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli silenced critics with stellar performances, with Kohli averaging 151 and winning Man of the Series. The programme also analyses Yashasvi Jaiswal's timely century and the depth of the Indian squad, noting that regular captain Shubman Gill is set to return once fit. The aggressive approach of the team is also examined.

Another peak at 36? Virat Kohli says liberated mindset driving best phase in yearsVirat Kohli delivered a stellar performance in India's 2-1 ODI series win over South Africa. His record-breaking run tally and Player of the Series award highlight a remarkable resurgence in ODI cricket.

How Ro-Ko helped Yashasvi Jaiswal rediscover form and hit his maiden ODI hundredVizag centurion Yashasvi Jaiswal expressed his gratitude after scoring his maiden ODI hundred, explaining how senior pros Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli helped steady his nerves during India's 271-run chase against South Africa at the ACA-VDCA Cricket Stadium on Saturday.

Toss, match, and series. Ruthless India rout South Africa in Vizag ODI deciderIndia vs South Africa, 3rd ODI: Yashasvi Jaiswal's maiden ODI hundred and fifties from Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma helped India chase 271 in just 39.5 overs in the series finale. Kuldeep Yadav and Prasidh Krishna picked four wickets each as South Africa were bowled out for 270, at least 80 runs short of a par total on a dewy evening in Visakhapatnam.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
